I'm happy to help you with some BBQ rib recipes! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or memories, so I didn't attend your family reunion or taste your mom's signature ribs.

But don't worry, I can definitely provide you with some delicious BBQ rib recipes that might just become your new family favorite! Here are a few options:

**Recipe 1: Classic BBQ Ribs with Dry Rub**

* 2 racks of pork ribs (St. Louis-style or baby back ribs)
* 1/4 cup dry rub (mix of paprika, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper)
* 1 cup BBQ sauce (your favorite brand or homemade)
* Wood chips or chunks for smoking (optional)

**Recipe 2: Memphis-Style Wet Ribs**

* 2 racks of pork ribs (St. Louis-style or baby back ribs)
* 1/4 cup BBQ sauce (sweet and tangy)
* 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
* 2 tablespoons brown sugar
* 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
* 1 teaspoon garlic powder
* Salt and pepper to taste

**Recipe 3: Korean-Style BBQ Ribs with Gochujang**

* 2 racks of pork ribs (St. Louis-style or baby back ribs)
* 1/4 cup gochujang (Korean chili paste)
* 2 tablespoons soy sauce
* 2 tablespoons brown sugar
* 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
* 1 teaspoon garlic, minced
* 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
* 1/4 cup chopped green onions for garnish

These are just a few examples to get you started. You can adjust the ingredients and cooking methods to suit your family's taste preferences. Don't forget to plan ahead, as slow-cooking ribs can take several hours to achieve that tender, fall-off-the-bone texture.

If you have any specific questions or need more guidance, feel free to ask!
